questions.question: It is dangerous to use chisels that have
A cold chisel that has a mushroomed head can be reclaimed by
options: Regrinding to the recommended included angle.
Grinding to the original shaft size.
Filing the head to a ball shape.
correctAnswer: Grinding to the original shaft size.

questions.question: File handles should be on files because
options: They reduce the risk of injury.
They protect the tang from damage.
They are available in a variety of attractive colours.
They protect the cutting edges on the face.
correctAnswer: They reduce the risk of injury.

questions.question: A split hammer handle is best repaired by
The safest way to use a wrench is to
options: Pull on it with steady pressure.
Push it away from your body.
Tap on it to get it started.
Put a pipe handle on it for extra leverage.
correctAnswer: Pull on it with steady pressure.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a wedge when replacing a hammer handle?
options: A wedge is used to tighten the end of the handle in the eye of the hammerhead.
A wedge is used to balance the hammer.
A wedge is used to provide grip to the hammer handle.
A wedge is used to protect the handle from damage.
A wedge is used to align the hammerhead with the handle.
correctAnswer: A wedge is used to tighten the end of the handle in the eye of the hammerhead.

questions.question: A combination square consists of
The most versatile type of square is the
A thin rule has an advantage over a thick rule when
options: Graduations are in 1/16 of an inch.

questions.question: A good tool for accurately transferring measurements is a
A flexible steel rule is an advantage when
To check whether or not a surface is at true vertical, you would use a
What is the recommended length of a wrap-a-round for marking a straight line around a pipe?
options: One complete turn around the pipe.
One and one quarter turns around the pipe.
correctAnswer: One and one quarter turns around the pipe.

questions.question: The size of pliers is determined by the
options: Maximum diameter the tool can grip.

questions.question: Vise grips have an advantage over pliers when
options: The tool has to grip round material.
A metric size wrench is not available.
You need to maintain a constant pressure.
You are working on non-ferrous material.
correctAnswer: You need to maintain a constant pressure.

questions.question: C-clamps are sized according to the
A bar clamp has an advantage when
options: Material needs to be clamped to a bar.
Pressure is applied in one spot.

questions.question: A 32 teeth per inch hacksaw blade is the best choice for cutting
Files are classified by the
options: Job you have been asked to do.
Size, width, and kind of material.

questions.question: Explain why filing is done only on the forward stroke.
options: Dragging the file backwards will break the teeth from the file.
Filing on the forward stroke is more efficient.
Backward filing will dull the file.
Forward filing creates a smoother finish.
Backward filing can cause uneven wear on the file.
correctAnswer: Dragging the file backwards will break the teeth from the file.

questions.question: Compound action snips have an advantage over tinners' snips when
options: The metal is thicker than 16 gauge.
Non-ferrous metals are to be cut.
The cut must follow a curve.
correctAnswer: The cut must follow a curve.

questions.question: Tinners' snips are sized according to the
The cutting edge of a cold chisel should be prepared to a _______ degree angle for softer materials and up to _______ degrees for very hard materials.
List an advantage an aluminum pipe wrench has over a steel pipe wrench.
options: Aluminum pipe wrenches are lighter than steel pipe wrenches.
Aluminum pipe wrenches are more durable than steel pipe wrenches.
Aluminum pipe wrenches provide a better grip than steel pipe wrenches.
Aluminum pipe wrenches are more resistant to corrosion than steel pipe wrenches.
Aluminum pipe wrenches are cheaper than steel pipe wrenches.
correctAnswer: Aluminum pipe wrenches are lighter than steel pipe wrenches.

questions.question: Explain how open end, box end and combination wrenches are rated for size.
options: They are sized according to the size of nut or bolt head for which they can be used.
They are sized according to the length of the wrench.
They are sized according to the width of the handle.
They are sized according to the material they are made from.
They are sized according to the weight of the wrench.
correctAnswer: They are sized according to the size of nut or bolt head for which they can be used.

questions.question: Explain how adjustable and pipe wrenches are rated for size.
options: The overall length of the tool determines size.
The width of the jaws determines size.
The weight of the tool determines size.
The material of the tool determines size.
The size of the nut or bolt head it can accommodate determines size.
correctAnswer: The overall length of the tool determines size.

questions.question: How are sockets sized?
options: By the total number of points.
By measuring the distance across the points.
By measuring the distance across the flats.
By the depth of the socket.
correctAnswer: By measuring the distance across the flats.

questions.question: An adjustable wrench is recommended when
options: The points of the nut are rounded over.
You are working with metric fasteners.
A proper fitting wrench is not available.
Square nuts are used instead of hex nuts.
correctAnswer: A proper fitting wrench is not available.

questions.question: An MJ torque wrench exerts a torque pressure of _____________ on the 5/16 nut of an MJ coupling.
Soil pipe cutters are designed to _____________.
Fish tapes are made of
What wrench would you choose when installing a valve on a piping project?
